Exaggerate: The claim falsely purports that the video shows a man burning 80 ballots cast for President Donald Trump, when in fact the ballots shown are sample ballots.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the ballots shown in the video are sample ballots, not actual ballots used to cast votes.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the video shows ballots being burned.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video depicts actual ballots being burned, without verifying the authenticity of the ballots.
Understate: The claim understates the significance of the video being debunked by local officials in Virginia on Election Day.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the video, such as the possibility of it being staged or manipulated.
